verses.verse: Remember <S%H2142><s%> also your Creator <S%H1254><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of your youth, <S%H979><s%> before the evil <S%H7451><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> come, <S%H935><s%> and the years <S%H8141><s%> draw near, <S%H5060><s%> when you will say, <S%H559><s%> "I have no pleasure in them; <S%H2656><s%>"

Before the sun, <S%H8121><s%> the light, <S%H216><s%> the moon, <S%H3394><s%> and the stars <S%H3556><s%> are darkened, <S%H2821><s%> and the clouds <S%H5645><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the rain; <S%H1653><s%>

in the day <S%H3117><s%> when the keepers <S%H8104><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> shall tremble, <S%H2111><s%> and the strong <S%H2428><s%> men <S%H582><s%> shall bow <S%H5791><s%> themselves, <S%H2912><s%> and the grinders cease <S%H988><s%> because they are few, <S%H4591><s%> and those who look out <S%H7200><s%> of the windows <S%H699><s%> are darkened, <S%H2821><s%>

and the doors <S%H1817><s%> shall be shut <S%H5462><s%> in the street; <S%H7784><s%> when the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the grinding <S%H2913><s%> is low, <S%H8217><s%> and one shall rise up <S%H6965><s%> at the voice <S%H6963><s%> of a bird, <S%H6833><s%> and all the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of music <S%H7892><s%> shall be brought low; <S%H7817><s%>

yes, <S%H3372><s%> they shall be afraid of heights, <S%H1364><s%> and terrors <S%H2849><s%> will be in the way; <S%H1870><s%> and the almond tree <S%H8247><s%> shall blossom, <S%H5006><s%> and the grasshopper <S%H2284><s%> shall be a burden, <S%H5445><s%> and desire <S%H35><s%> shall fail; <S%H6565><s%> because man <S%H120><s%> goes <S%H1980><s%> to his everlasting <S%H5769><s%> home, <S%H1004><s%> and the mourners <S%H5594><s%> go about <S%H5437><s%> the streets: <S%H7784><s%>

before <S%H3808><s%> the silver <S%H3701><s%> cord <S%H2256><s%> is severed, <S%H7576><s%> or the golden <S%H2091><s%> bowl <S%H1543><s%> is broken, <S%H7533><s%> or the pitcher <S%H3537><s%> is broken <S%H7665><s%> at the spring, <S%H4002><s%> or the wheel <S%H1534><s%> broken <S%H7533><s%> at the cistern, <S%H953><s%>
and the dust <S%H6083><s%> returns <S%H7725><s%> to the earth <S%H776><s%> as it was, <S%H7307><s%> and the spirit returns <S%H7725><s%> to God <S%H430><s%> who gave it. <S%H5414><s%>
"Vanity <S%H1892><s%> of vanities, <S%H1892><s%>" says <S%H559><s%> the Preacher. <S%H6953><s%> "All is vanity! <S%H1892><s%>"

Further, <S%H3148><s%> because the Preacher <S%H6953><s%> was wise, <S%H2450><s%> he still taught <S%H3925><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> knowledge. <S%H1847><s%> Yes, <S%H239><s%> he pondered, sought out, <S%H2713><s%> and set in order <S%H8626><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> proverbs. <S%H4912><s%>

The Preacher <S%H6953><s%> sought <S%H1245><s%> to find out <S%H4672><s%> acceptable <S%H2656><s%> words, <S%H1697><s%> and that which was written <S%H3789><s%> blamelessly, <S%H3476><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> of truth. <S%H571><s%>

The words <S%H1697><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> are like goads; <S%H1861><s%> and like nails <S%H4930><s%> well fastened <S%H5193><s%> are words from the masters <S%H1167><s%> of assemblies, <S%H627><s%> which are given <S%H5414><s%> from one <S%H259><s%> shepherd. <S%H7462><s%>

Furthermore, <S%H3148><s%> my son, <S%H1121><s%> be admonished: <S%H2094><s%> of <S%H1992><s%> making <S%H6213><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> books <S%H5612><s%> there is no end; <S%H7093><s%> and much <S%H7235><s%> study <S%H3854><s%> is a weariness <S%H3024><s%> of the flesh. <S%H1320><s%>

This is the end <S%H5490><s%> of the matter. <S%H1697><s%> All has been heard. <S%H8085><s%> Fear <S%H3372><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> and keep <S%H8104><s%> his commandments; <S%H4687><s%> for this is the whole duty of man. <S%H120><s%>

For God <S%H430><s%> will bring <S%H935><s%> every work <S%H4639><s%> into judgment, <S%H4941><s%> with every hidden thing, <S%H5956><s%> whether it is good, <S%H2896><s%> or whether it is evil. <S%H7451><s%>
